title: Snowplow Data Structure
description: Defines the structure of a Snowplow data structure, which encapsulates a Snowplow self-describing JSON schema and its associated metadata.

data.description: A marker event indicating a user viewed their shopping cart. Details of the cart items would be in attached entities.
Provides detailed context about a product. Could be attached to events like 'cart_viewed' or 'product_viewed'.

sku.description: Stock Keeping Unit, primary key for product.

unitPrice.description: Price per unit of the product.

apiVersion.description: The version of this data structure resource format. Currently fixed at 'v1'.

resourceType.description: The type of resource being described. For Snowplow data structures, this is always 'data-structure'.

meta.description: Metadata associated with the Snowplow data structure.

hidden.description: If true, this data structure will be hidden in the BDP Console.

schemaType.description: Indicates whether this schema defines an 'event' (an action, e.g., page view, click) or an 'entity' (contextual information about an event, e.g., user details, product information).

customData.description: An open object for storing arbitrary key-value pairs of custom metadata related to this data structure. Useful for integration-specific information or extended annotations.

data.description: The core Snowplow self-describing JSON schema, which defines the actual structure of the event or entity data. For a public registry of Snowplow schemas, see Iglu Central: https://github.com/snowplow/iglu-central/tree/master/schemas.

allOf.description: The core Snowplow self-describing JSON schema, which defines the actual structure of the event or entity data. For a public registry of Snowplow schemas, see Iglu Central: https://github.com/snowplow/iglu-central/tree/master/schemas.

self.description: The self-describing identifier for the schema, providing its unique identity.

vendor.description: The vendor or organization responsible for the schema, typically in reverse domain name notation (e.g., 'com.snowplowanalytics', 'com.acme').

name.description: The name of the schema, identifying the event or entity (e.g., 'page_view', 'user')

format.description: The format of the schema. For Snowplow JSON schemas, this is typically 'jsonschema'.

version.description: The version of the schema in SchemaVer format (MODEL-REVISION-ADDITION, e.g., '1-0-0'). CRITICAL: Increment MODEL (e.g., 1-x-x to 2-0-0) for ANY breaking change that could reject previously valid data (removals, type changes, constraint tightening). Increment REVISION (e.g., 1-0-x to 1-1-0) only for non-breaking additions (new optional properties, constraint loosening). Increment ADDITION (e.g., 1-0-0 to 1-0-1) for editorial changes only.

allOf.description: Ensures the content is a valid JSON Schema (Draft-04).

buttonId.description: The ID of the button clicked.

buttonText.description: The text content of the button.

examples.description: Schema for 'user_details' providing context about the user performing an action.
